alert.note: Alert for Inland Indian River; Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Okeechobee, west central Indian River and southeastern Osceola Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Kissimmee to 9 miles south of Kenansville to near Kissimmee Prairie Preserve. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Kissimmee, Lake Marian, Kenansville, and Kissimmee Prairie Preserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
